1.text: Jesus left that place and came into his own country, and his disciples followed him.

2.text: When the Sabbath came, he began to teach in the synagogue. Hearing him, many were astonished, saying, “Where did this man get these things?” and, “What is the wisdom that is given to him, [that] such powerful works come about by his hands?

3.text: Is this not the carpenter, the son of Mary, and brother of James, Joses, Judah, and Simon? Are not his sisters here with us?” And they rejected him.

4.text: Jesus said to them, “A prophet is not without honor, except in his own country, and among his own relatives, and in his own house.”

5.text: He could not perform any miracles there, except that he laid his hands on a few sick people and healed them.

6.text: He was astonished because of their unbelief. He went around the villages, teaching.

7.text: Calling to himself the Twelve, he began to send them out two by two and gave them authority over the unclean spirits.

8.text: He told them to take nothing for their journey, except for a staff: no wallet, no bread, no money in their purse.

9.text: He also told them to wear sandals and not put on two tunics.

10.text: He said to them, “Wherever you enter into a house, stay there until you depart from the area.

11.text: And whoever does not welcome you or listen to you, when you leave, shake off the dust under your feet as a testimony against them.  Amen, I can tell you that in the day of judgment, things will be more tolerable for Sodom and Gomorrah than for that city!”

12.text: They went out and preached that people should repent.

13.text: They also cast out many demons and anointed with oil many people who were sick and healed them.

14.text: King Herod heard this report, for Jesus’ name had become well known, and he said, “John the Baptizer has risen from the dead! This is why these powers are at work in him!”

15.text: But others said, “He is Elias (Elijah).” Others said, “He is a prophet, like one of the prophets [of old]!”

16.text: But when he heard this, Herod said, “This is John whom I beheaded. He has risen from the dead!”

17.text: For Herod himself had ordered that John be arrested, and he had him chained in prison. This was for the sake of Herodias, the [former] wife of his brother Philip, for Herod had married her.

18.text: John had said to Herod, “It is not lawful for you to have your brother’s wife!”

19.text: Herodias became furious against John and desired to kill him, but she could not

20.text: because Herod feared John. He knew that John was a righteous and holy man, and kept him safe. When he heard John speak, he did many things, and liked to listen to him.

21.text: An opportunity came when on his birthday Herod gave a banquet for his nobles, high officers, and for the leading figures of Galilee.

22.text: When the daughter of Herodias came in and danced and pleased Herod and those sitting with him, the king said to the girl, “Ask me whatever you want, and I will give it to you!”

23.text: He swore to her, “Whatever you shall ask of me, I will give you, up to half of my kingdom!”

24.text: She went out and said to her mother, “What shall I ask?” Herodias answered, “The head of John the Baptizer!”

25.text: At once, the girl hurried to the king and said, “I want you to give me right now the head of John the Baptizer on a platter.”

26.text: The king was extremely sorry, but for the sake of his oaths and because of his dinner guests, he did not wish to deny her.

27.text: Immediately, the king sent out a soldier of his guard and commanded that John’s head be brought. The soldier went off and beheaded John in the prison,

28.text: and brought his head on a platter and gave it to the girl. And she gave it to her mother.

29.text: When John’s disciples heard this, they came, took his body, and laid it in a tomb.

30.text: The apostles came back together around Jesus and told him both what they had done and taught.

31.text: Because there were many [people] coming and going, the apostles did not even have time to eat. Jesus then said to them, “You should go away into a deserted place and rest for a while.”

32.text: They went away in the boat to a deserted place by themselves.

33.text: The multitudes saw them going away and many recognized Jesus. People rushed there on foot from all the [surrounding] cities and arrived before the disciples, and came together to him.

34.text: Jesus came out, saw a great crowd, and he had compassion on them, because they were like sheep without a shepherd. He then began to teach them many things.

35.text: When it was late in the day, his disciples came to him and said, “This place is deserted and it is late in the day!

36.text: Send them away so that they may go into the surrounding countryside and villages to buy bread, for they have nothing to eat.”

37.text: But Jesus answered them, “You give them something to eat!” They asked him, “Shall we go and buy two hundred denarii worth of bread, and give them something to eat?”

38.text: Jesus replied, “How many loaves do you have? Go and see.” When they had found out, they said, “Five loaves and two fish.”

39.text: Jesus gave them instructions that everyone should sit down in groups on the green grass,

40.text: and people sat down in groups of hundreds and fifties.

41.text: He took the five loaves and the two fish, and looking up to heaven, he blessed and broke the loaves. He then gave it to the disciples to set before the people, and he distributed the two fish among them all.

43.text: and the disciples collected twelve baskets full of broken pieces and of the [leftover] fish.

44.text: Those who ate the loaves numbered five thousand men.

45.text: At once, Jesus made his disciples get into the boat and go on ahead to the other side, to Bethsaida, while he himself sent the crowd away.

46.text: After he had taken leave of them, he went up the mountain to pray.

47.text: When evening came, the boat was in the middle of the sea while Jesus was alone on the shore.

48.text: Then he saw them being battered as they rowed, because the wind was against them. Now about the fourth watch of the night, he came to them, walking on the sea, and would have passed them by.

49.text: But when they saw him walking on the sea, they thought that it was a ghost and cried out.

50.text: They all saw him and were troubled, but immediately, Jesus spoke with them and said, “Rejoice! It is I! Do not be afraid!”

51.text: He got into the boat with them and the wind ceased. They were utterly astonished beyond measure and marveled greatly

52.text: because they had not understood about the [miracle of the] loaves, but their hearts were hardened.

53.text: After crossing over, they came to the land at Gennesaret and moored the boat to the shore.

54.text: When they came out of the boat, the people immediately recognized Jesus.

55.text: They swarmed that whole surrounding region and began to bring the sick on mats to wherever they heard that he was.

56.text: Wherever he entered, into villages, cities, or country, people laid the sick in the marketplaces and begged him to be able to touch just the fringe of his garment; and as many as touched him were made well.
